citations.narrative:
The outdoor harbor seal facility is not fully enclosed by a perimeter fence. There is a semi-circular outdoor pool that
houses four adult harbor seal. The seals have free access to the outdoor pool as well as an indoor pool accessible
through the back (west side) of the exhibit throughout the day and night. The front (east side) of the outdoor pool is
positioned toward the non-gated public entrance to the aquarium from the main road. There is no perimeter fence
enclosing the harbor seal exhibit. Alternative security measures in place have not been approved by the APHIS
Administrator.
Perimeter fences protect animals by deterring the entry of unauthorized people or animals.
Correct by installing a perimeter fence that is at least 6' tall, no less than 3 feet in distance from the enclosure housing
animals and is constructed to effectively prevent the entry of unauthorized people or animals, or by requesting written
approval for alternative measures from the Administrator. Temporary correction due by April 17, 2024, permanent
correction due by July 18, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Vice President of Animal Care and the Attending Veterinarian.
n
